definition.core: Represents how the individual generates motivation, reinforcement, and reward. Determines what experiences feel fulfilling, energizing, or validating.

axes.achievement_reward: Seeks mastery, competence, progress, and improvement. Reinforced by personal accomplishment.
axes.connection_reward: Seeks closeness, affirmation, shared experiences, and relational harmony.
axes.novelty_reward: Seeks stimulation, exploration, curiosity, and new experiences.
axes.stability_reward: Seeks predictability, routine, comfort, and low-variance environments.

behavioral_markers: gravitates toward situations that produce preferred reward signals
avoids or disengages from contexts lacking reward potency
self-reinforces behaviors aligned with dominant reward axis
higher stress when core reward source is blocked or threatened
